step1.sentence: After reviewing the evidence, the lawyer decided to challenge a decision made by the lower court.

step2.story: Maria couldn't believe the committee rejected her proposal without even reading it. She gathered all her supporting documents and marched into the director's office to challenge a decision she felt was deeply unfair. By the end of the meeting, they agreed to reconsider.

step3.story: When the city council announced plans to demolish the old community library, residents were outraged. Jin-ho, a retired teacher who had spent thirty years guiding students through those shelves, organized a town hall meeting. He stood before the crowd and urged everyone to challenge a decision that would erase decades of shared memory. Armed with petitions and alternative proposals, the group presented their case at the next council session. The council members listened carefully, and after a heated but respectful debate, they voted to preserve the building. Jin-ho smiled quietly, knowing that one voice had sparked a hundred more.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 결정(decision)에 도전하다(challenge), 즉 이미 내려진 결정에 반대 의견을 제기하는 것을 뜻합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 공식적인 자리에서 결정이나 판결에 이의를 제기하거나 재검토를 요청할 때 사용합니다. 법적, 행정적 맥락뿐 아니라 일상적인 직장이나 조직 내에서도 널리 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: challenge는 고대 프랑스어 'chalenge(고발, 이의 제기)'에서 유래했으며, 라틴어 'calumnia(거짓 고발)'에 뿌리를 두고 있습니다. 현대 영어에서는 '이의를 제기하다, 문제를 삼다'라는 의미로 발전했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순히 불만을 표현하는 것이 아니라, 논리적 근거를 가지고 공식적으로 반대 의사를 표명하는 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 격식 있는 표현으로, 감정적 대립보다는 이성적 이의 제기를 암시합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The employee chose to challenge a decision that affected the entire team's workload.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 직원은 팀 전체의 업무량에 영향을 미치는 결정에 이의를 제기하기로 했다.
